intro: Origanum piperella, commonly known as wild oregano, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are fragrant and contain essential oils that contribute to its distinctive flavor. It is often used in culinary applications and traditional herbal medicine.
